Line 115: Line 115:
== CNR on other Linux systems ==
== CNR on other Linux systems ==
â
Linspire planned to port the CNR service to the [[Ubuntu (linux distribution)|Ubuntu]] distribution, the company announced plans on [[April 24]] [[2006]] to release CNR under a [[free software license|free software]]/[[open source license]]. It could then be used by other Linux distributions.
+
Linspire planned to port the CNR service to the [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] distribution, the company announced plans on [[April 24]] [[2006]] to release CNR under a [[free software license|free software]]/[[open source license]]. It could then be used by other Linux distributions.
On [[January 23]], [[2007]] (almost 9 months to the day that CNR's relicensing was announced), a "CNR for all" website was launched; however, the launching of the warehouse itself was announced for Q2 of 2007. The release of the new free/open-source CNR client and plug-in is planned to coincide with the release of [[Freespire]] 2.0 and Linspire 6.0, both of which will include the free/open-source CNR client and plug-in<ref>[http://wiki.freespire.org/index.php/Freespire_Roadmap Freespire Roadmap - Freespire<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> (this new CNR is known internally at Linspire/Freespire as "CNR 7"<ref>[http://wiki.freespire.org/index.php/Freespire_2.0_Schedule Freespire 2.0 Schedule - Freespire<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>).
On [[January 23]], [[2007]] (almost 9 months to the day that CNR's relicensing was announced), a "CNR for all" website was launched; however, the launching of the warehouse itself was announced for Q2 of 2007. The release of the new free/open-source CNR client and plug-in is planned to coincide with the release of [[Freespire]] 2.0 and Linspire 6.0, both of which will include the free/open-source CNR client and plug-in<ref>[http://wiki.freespire.org/index.php/Freespire_Roadmap Freespire Roadmap - Freespire<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> (this new CNR is known internally at Linspire/Freespire as "CNR 7"<ref>[http://wiki.freespire.org/index.php/Freespire_2.0_Schedule Freespire 2.0 Schedule - Freespire<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>).
Line 121: Line 121:
=== Support ===
=== Support ===
â
Six distributions are expected to be supported at the time of the upcoming CNR 7 launch: [[Debian]], [[Fedora Core]], [[Freespire]], [[Linspire]], [[openSUSE]], and [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu (Feisty Fawn)]].<ref name "cnrfaq">http://www.cnr.com/faq.html#cnrfaq</ref> Support for other distributions is expected starting in 2008.<ref name "cnrfaq">http://www.cnr.com/faq.html#cnrfaq</ref>
+
Six distributions are expected to be supported at the time of the upcoming CNR 7 launch: [[Debian]], [[Fedora Core]], [[Freespire]], [[Linspire]], [[openSUSE]], and [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu (Feisty Fawn)]].<ref name "cnrfaq">http://www.cnr.com/faq.html#cnrfaq</ref> Support for other distributions is expected starting in 2008.<ref name "cnrfaq">http://www.cnr.com/faq.html#cnrfaq</ref>
A test version of CNR 7 was released on [[July 19]], [[2007]].<ref>[http://wiki.freespire.org/index.php?title=Freespire_2.0_Schedule&oldid=10441 Freespire 2.0 Schedule - Freespire<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>.
A test version of CNR 7 was released on [[July 19]], [[2007]].<ref>[http://wiki.freespire.org/index.php?title=Freespire_2.0_Schedule&oldid=10441 Freespire 2.0 Schedule - Freespire<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>.
